TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit IndentedStringBuilder extends System.Object

summary.para: A thin wrapper over that adds indentation to each line built.
This type is typically used by database providers (and other extensions). It is generally not used in application code.

Docs.summary: Appends the current indent and then the given string to the string being built.

summary.para: Appends the current indent, the given string, and a new line to the string being built.
If the given string itself contains a new line, the part of the string after that new line will not be indented.

Docs.returns: This builder so that additional calls can be chained.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.IndentedStringBuilder AppendLines (string value, bool skipFinalNewline = false);

Docs.param: If true, then the terminating new line is not added after the last line.
Docs.summary: Separates the given string into lines, and then appends each line, prefixed by the current indent and followed by a new line, to the string being built.
Docs.returns: This builder so that additional calls can be chained.
